org.araneaframework.http.filter
Class StandardFileUploadFilterService

java.lang.Object
  org.araneaframework.core.BaseComponent
      org.araneaframework.core.BaseService
          org.araneaframework.framework.core.BaseFilterService
              org.araneaframework.http.filter.StandardFileUploadFilterService
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Component, FileUploadContext, FilterService, Service
public class StandardFileUploadFilterService
extends BaseFilterService
implements FileUploadContext

This filter uses Commons FileUpload to parse the request and upload the multipart/form-data encoded files to a temporary directory.

Author:
Jevgeni Kabanov (ekabanov at araneaframework dot org)
See Also:

Field Detail

FAIL_RESPONSE

public static final String FAIL_RESPONSE
The response message, if the user submits a multipart request that is larger than maximumSize or allowed by ServletFileUpload. Because Apache Commons FileUpload basically blocks and removes the "illegal" content then we have no simple way to access it, and still use it, although, only the file perhaps was too large. Consider it as a security feature. To allow larger requests, use setMaximumSize(Long) (at your own risk).

Since:
1.2.2
See Also:

Method Detail

setMultipartEncoding

public void setMultipartEncoding(String multipartEncoding)
Sets the character encoding that will be used to decode the multipart/form-data encoded strings. The default encoding is determined by Commons FileUpload.

Parameters:
multipartEncoding - The encoding that is used to read request when useRequestEncoding is set to false.

setUseRequestEncoding

public void setUseRequestEncoding(boolean useRequestEncoding)
When set to "true" will use the request character encoding to parse the multipart/form-data encoded strings.

Parameters:
useRequestEncoding - Whether to use the request encoding instead of multipartEncoding to read request data.

getFileSizeLimit

public Long getFileSizeLimit()
Returns the maximum allowed file size. If the value of maximumSize is not provided then the Apache File Upload is checked for the same limit.

sortParsedItems

protected Exception sortParsedItems(List parsedItems,
                                    Map fileItems,
                                    Map parameters,
                                    String requestEncoding)
                             throws Exception
Sorts the parsed items by reading the parsed values and putting them into fileItems or parameters. The requestEncoding parameter is provided to help to read the values from request with the right encoding.

This method alse checks that no file is greater in size that allowed. If there is a problem with that then an exception is returned.

Parameters:
parsedItems - The items parsed from the multipart request.
fileItems - The map where to put all read file items as <field-name,file> pairs.
parameters - The map where to put all other form input as <field-name,value> pairs.
requestEncoding - The request encoding. May be null.
Returns:
An Exception object, if there was a problem with a file.
Throws:
Exception - Unexpected exceptions related to reading the values.
Since:
1.2.2

afterMultipartRequestParsing

protected void afterMultipartRequestParsing(boolean parsingSucceeded,
                                            InputData input,
                                            OutputData output,
                                            Map parameters,
                                            Map fileItems,
                                            Exception uploadException)
                                     throws Exception
After-processing when multipart request is processed and the request data is sorted.

Parameters:
parsingSucceeded - A Boolean indicating whether there was a problem with parsing the input (e.g. the request size was greater than allowed).
input - The Aranea input holder.
output - The Aranea output holder.
parameters - The parsed parameters and their values.
fileItems - The parsed file params and their files.
uploadException - The exception from sorting parsed parameters.
Throws:
Various - unexpected exceptions.
Exception
Since:
1.2.2
